channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Tariffs (Probably) Won’t Cause Inflation (But Still Raise Prices)
item.description: Not all bad economic policy is inflationary, and not causing inflation doesn’t make economic policy good.

item.title: The Quest to Hold Hamas Accountable for Sexual Violence
item.description: When and if terrorists now detained in Israel are prosecuted, they should be charged with sexual violence, authors of a new report advise.

item.title: The Alcaraz-Sinner Rivalry Is Kicking Off A New Generation Of Tennis Greats
item.description: The next golden age of men’s tennis is unfolding before our very eyes, and that should make everyone happy — including the pickleball players.

item.title: Everything That’s Going On
item.description: Something has gone Deeply Wrong in the United States since November of last year.

item.title: In Congress, Two Paths Emerge for Republicans on Immigration
item.description: Border security is a settled issue, but the questions of what to do with legal immigration and long-term illegal residents still divide the party.

item.title: IVF Experiments That Mix And Match Multiple Adults’ DNA Are Bad For Kids And Society
item.description: Scientists are paving the way for people in polyamorous relationships to commission the creation of children with their DNA.

item.title: Top 10 Most Read Blogs from Q2: AI, Alpha, and a Shifting Global Order
item.description: AI disruption, portfolio shifts, and timeless lessons—these blogs topped the charts in Q2.

item.title: Book Review: The Behavioral Portfolio
item.description: Phillip Toews challenges traditional portfolio construction, helping advisors build resilient strategies and coach clients through risk and bias.

item.title: Rethinking Research: Private GPTs for Investment Analysis
item.description: This chatbot-style tool allows investment analysts to query complex research materials in plain language without ever exposing sensitive data.

item.title: Mind the Inflation Gap: Hedging with Real Assets
item.description: Timely insights on portfolio risk, inflation hedging, and market cycles—grounded in financial history and written for investment decision-makers.

item.title: Book Review: Cheaper Faster Better: How We’ll Win the Climate War
item.description: Can capitalism save the planet? Tom Steyer makes the case in this urgent, optimistic roadmap to a net-zero future.
